CRandomEvent.Headline: Offer from Big Pharma
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: Good afternoon, {CandidateLName}. You seem like a promising candidate and one the company I represent is most interested in ...working with. We can offer some funds in exchange for a favorable position on Pharmaceutical Companies.

Option.DisplayName: That sounds like a good deal, I accept. This won't get out to the American People, right?
Option.FollowUpText:
Excellent. We appreciate your support. And to answer your question, this will remain perfectly silent. (A crowd of News Reporters flood in the room asking about the meeting)
[+200K Funds, +20 Stance on Pharmaceutical Companies, -1% Enthusiasm in All States.]

Option.DisplayName: I can't accept your offer.
Option.FollowUpText:
Pity. We'll simply have to pursue other methods of getting our good word out.
[-20 Stance on Pharmaceutical Companies in all States, +2 Issue Importance on Pharmaceutical Companies in all States.]

CRandomEvent.Headline: Rough Landing
CRandomEvent.Paragraph:
Upon trying to land, an issue with the landing equipment caused an unexpected delay. While the repair is simple and inexpensive, the time and opportunities it has cost are harsh.
[-4 Stamina]

Option.DisplayName: Understood

CRandomEvent.Headline: Car Stumble
CRandomEvent.Paragraph:
While trying to enter your motorcade, you were seen falling, and stumbling into your seat, before a crowd of assistants pulled you up. The media have begun to portray you as too weak to be president.
[Lose All Stamina, -7% Enthusiasm in Current State, -3% Enthusiasm in All States]

Option.DisplayName: Understood

CRandomEvent.Headline: Message from Mysterious Photographer
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: I'll keep this short -I have a somewhat unflattering photo of you. It's not incriminating or explicit, but it is embarrassing. For 250K I could ensure the photo never makes it from my camera.

Option.DisplayName: I'd pay more for a good photo.
Option.FollowUpText:
You're a clever candidate. You may have what it takes to be President after all. Alright, I'll see what I can do.
[-1M Funds, +2% Enthusiasm in all States.]

Option.DisplayName: You have a deal, even if it is slimy.
Option.FollowUpText:
I appreciate you understand the importance of a clean public image.
[-250K Funds]

Option.DisplayName: Release the photo; I'm too busy to care.
Option.FollowUpText:
Sorry to have wasted both our time.
[-10% Enthusiasm in all States.]

CRandomEvent.Headline: Nearby Natural Disaster
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: A recent disaster has struck the local community at your latest stop. The tragedy has left many in need and working to recover. It might not be glorious work or deliver a particular message, but spending time helping could revitalize your public image. You'd be sacrificing the rest of your Stamina for Enthusiasm.

Option.DisplayName: Help the Relief Effort.
Option.FollowUpText:
You roll up your sleeves and, in front of plenty of cameras, help those affected by one of the most recent natural disasters.
[Lose all Stamina, +10% Enthusiasm in current state.]

Option.DisplayName: Avoid the Disaster Area.
Option.FollowUpText:
The Media mock you for avoiding the area.
[-5% Enthusiasm in all States.]

CRandomEvent.Headline: Call from Newspaper Insider
CRandomEvent.Paragraph:
I have thirty seconds. I'm just calling to let you know that tomorrow's headlines will be dominated by the birth of some endangered animal at some zoo someplace. I've told no one else. Anyways, gotta go. Bye!
[Next Turn: Decrease Ad Effectiveness in all states by 40% for 1 turn]

Option.DisplayName: Thanks for the heads-up.

NotificationPopupFlavorText.PopupText: Headlines and top stories are sidetracked by something other than politics. The story will pass and attention will return, but for the time ads will be less effective.

CRandomEvent.Headline: Message from a Colleague
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: Hey {CandidateLName}. Been watching your campaign from a distance whenever I can spare a second. I can't offer anything directly, but I might know someone who knows someone. What would help the most?

Option.DisplayName: I need more energy to get more done.
Option.FollowUpText:
Oh! I've got some good news for that. I know someone who owns a coffee shop. They'll happily support a high-profile candidate with some free, super-caffeinated stuff.
[Gain 3 Extra Coffee cards (0 Cost, Gain 2 Stamina).]

Option.DisplayName: I keep running out of Political Capital.
Option.FollowUpText:
I know a few newly elected politicians that could get you a bit more sway in D.C.
[Gain 2 Naive Politician cards (0 Cost, Gain 0.5 Political Capital for 3 turns).]
Option.FollowUpResponse: I'll make sure they get experience.

Option.DisplayName: I need some funds; this campaign is proving expensive.
Option.FollowUpText:
I can't get you funds directly, but I might know a few mysterious donors looking to burn some cash.
[Gain 1 Mysterious Donors card (0 Cost, Increase Fundraising Effectiveness 300% for 1 turn).]

CRandomEvent.Headline: Loss of Industry
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: A nearby community at your latest stop has suffered a devastating loss of jobs. A confluence of factors has taken an industry away that once supported the entire metropolitan area, leaving many out of work and newly laid off. Getting out of the area will be hard without addressing the issue.

Option.DisplayName: Promise to bring the jobs back.
Option.FollowUpText:
You promise to work closely with the corporations to identify regulations, taxes, and tariffs that would encourage them to bring jobs back to the area.
[-10 Stance on Job Outsourcing in all States.]

Option.DisplayName: Promise to better train people for new jobs.
Option.FollowUpText:
You promise to funnel resources into programs that will help train those out of work for new jobs that require skilled labor and specialization.
[+10 Stance on Job Training in all States.]

Option.DisplayName: Give only non-committal responses.
Option.FollowUpText:
You avoid ever addressing the issue directly and attempt to express sympathies. It's not particularly comforting or effective.
[-10% Enthusiasm in the State]

CRandomEvent.Headline: Alma Mater Speaking Engagement
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: Your alma mater (or at least a school willing to say you graduated from it) has asked you to deliver a short virtual speech to the current student body. Such a speaking opportunity is an excellent opportunity to spread your message to a younger group about issues they care about.

Option.DisplayName: Support student loan forgiveness.
Option.FollowUpText:
You take the opportunity to reinforce your campaign message about Student Loan Forgiveness.
[+2 Importance to College Expenses/Student Debt in all States, +2% Enthusiasm in all States]

Option.DisplayName: Oppose cancel culture.
Option.FollowUpText:
You take the opportunity to reinforce your campaign message about Cancel Culture.
[+2 Importance to Cancel Culture in all States, +2% Enthusiasm in all States]

Option.DisplayName: Politely refuse.

CRandomEvent.Headline: Reply All
CRandomEvent.Paragraph: Someone on your campaign team recently accidentally hit 'Reply All' to an email and complained about working for you. The email ended up online before you saw it or had a chance to address it. You can't let the complaints go unanswered.

Option.DisplayName: Meet with the aid to discuss their grievances.
Option.FollowUpText:
You take time out of your busy schedule to meet with the aid in person. After a long (mostly) private conversation, you identify some key problems and how to resolve them.
[4 Stamina, +60% Ad Effectiveness for 2 turns.]

NotificationNewsTickerText.NewsText: {TargetName} met with a disgruntled aid and increased their Ad Effectiveness while at it.

Option.DisplayName: How about a little... help?
Option.FollowUpText:
You discreetly hand the aid 50K.
[-50K Funds.]

Option.DisplayName: Get your spin team to turn the criticism into a joke.
Option.FollowUpText:
You get your spin team to use some of your ad investments to refocus the story to paint you in a better light. The Media loves it, but the American People see through it.
[-40% Ad Effectiveness for 3 turns, -5% Enthusiasm in all States]

NotificationNewsTickerText.NewsText: A disgruntled email from the campaing of {TargetName} has detracted from their message, reducing their Ad Effectiveness.
